data.name: Generate a string to match a regex (reverse regex)
data.description:
Your task is to take a regular expression, and generate the shortest possible string that matches the regular expression.

For instance,

```python
reverse_regex(r'x*(a|bb|ccc)')  # "a"
reverse_regex(r'([0-9a-f]{2}:){5}[0-9a-f]{2}')  # "00:00:00:00:00:00"
```

The following regular expression features will be tested:

- Any character (`.`)
- Optional (`?`, `+`, `*`)
- Repetition (`{n}`, and `{n,m}`)
- Alternation (`|`)
- Groups (`(...)`) (but no capturing)
- Character classes (`[abc]` and `[a-z]`)
- Escapes (`\.`)

There may be more than one correct answer for a regular expression.  You may return any character in a character class (e.g., `[a-z]` or `.`), or any (shortest-length) submatch in an alternation that will successfully match.  Tests will check that the string is the shortest length while matching the provided regular expression but will not require a specific string.
